name: Parathas
author: Brittney Tun
summary: Parathas are the shallow-fried version of chapatis. This recipes make crunchier and less-flaky parathas than those I buy from the store. Serve with cinnamon-sugar for a sweet treat or with curries as a scooping bread.
directions: Mix all-purpose flour and whole wheat flour in a bowl
Add butter, sugar, garlic powder, and dried herbs
Pour water in gradually; continue to mix by hand until a soft dough is formed
Knead dough until smooth and elastic, about 7 minutes
Cover with a damp cloth; let rest for 30 minutes
Shape into smooth balls; lightly flatten
Dust with flour and roll into thin circles about 1/16-inch thick and 7 inches in diameter
Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat
Fry each dough circle until golden, about 2 minutes per side
